properties.prefix:
Animal Species


  • There are specific field-sets for recommended aspects of description. The “type” sub-field is used to fine tune the meaning, the “value” sub-field is used to indicate a key-word or phrase for that aspect, and the “note” sub-field is used for a longer text which amplifies the meaning or indicates a special consideration.

  • If there is no specific field-set for your purpose, use “keyword” for typed descriptive words or phrases and “note” for typed descriptive texts.

properties.description: The full scientific name. When forming part of an Identification, this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined.
properties.title: Species

properties.description: The name of the author and year of publication of a particular scientific name, e.g., Linnaeus, 1758.
properties.title: Scientific Name Authorship

properties.description: The type of variant such as Sub-Genus, Sub-Order, etc.
properties.title: Variant Type

properties.description: A variant name for the entity.
properties.title: Variant Name

properties.description: Keywords, subject terms, key phrases classification codes, etc., ideally drawn from a thesaurus, which classifies or describes the species and for which there are no more specific fields in the form.
properties.title: Keywords

properties.description: The type of keyword, such as Subject, Geographic or Temporal. Leaving type blank would imply general keywords.
properties.title: Keyword Type

properties.description: Formal strings of characters that are used to uniquely identify the species in various systems. This can also be used to create a formal identifier for the species for your project.
properties.title: Identifiers

properties.description: The name of the system or standard for which the identifier was created.
properties.title: Identifier Type

properties.description: A standard identifier for the entity, e.g. ISSN, opus no., etc., or a URI.
properties.title: Identifier

properties.description: Other entities that are related to the species, such as a species to which it has a symbiotic relationship.
properties.title: Relations

properties.description: General notes that provide descriptions for other aspects relevant to your understanding of the species, and for which there are no more specific fields in the form.
properties.title: Notes

properties.description: This can be used to register specific dates associated with the species, such as the year it was first identified, seasons when mating occurs, or an era when the species first emerged.
properties.title: Time Periods

properties.description: The type of time period such as Date Identified, with a numeric date below that gives the year, or the type could be “pupation” with the word “spring” entered into the textual date below.
properties.title: Time Period Type

properties.description: A textual date such as "20th Century" or the "Mesozoic era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A numeric date associated with the species being described such as Collected Date or Identified Date. To include a date range use two dates with the types “begin” and “end”.
properties.title: Numeric Dates

properties.description: The type of numeric date such as Begin or End Date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the date being described.
properties.title: Notes

properties.description: Spatial location information about the species being described, such as range or original place where it emerged, etc.
properties.title: Geographic Information

properties.description: The type of place being described such as, the place first identified or the first emergence location.
properties.title: Place Type

properties.description: Name of a geographic location pertaining to the entity being described e.g. Country, Province, Region, etc.
properties.title: Location Information

properties.description: This is used to identify the time period during which the place is relevant to the species.
properties.title: Time Periods

properties.description: A textual date pertaining to the place being described such as "last week" or the "Mesozoic era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A numeric date associated with the species being described such as Collected Date or Identified Date. To include a date range use two dates with the types “begin” and “end”.
properties.title: Numeric Dates

properties.description: The type of numeric date such as Begin or End Date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the place date being described.
properties.title: Date Notes

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the place being described.
properties.title: Place Notes

properties.description: This is used to identify people or organizations which have a special relationship to the species. For example, the person who first identified it, or an organization which runs a breeding program for it.
properties.title: Related People and Organizations

properties.description: The role of the person related to the species, such as “first identifier”.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: The name of the person.
properties.title: Person Name

properties.description: The role of the organization related to the species, such as “breeding program”.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: The name of the organization.
properties.title: Organization Name

properties.description: This element is used to identify physical characteristics associated with the species.
properties.title: Physical Description

properties.description: The category or type of the characteristic being described.
properties.title: Physical Description Type

properties.description: A word or phrase that classifies the physical characteristics of the chosen type. For longer textual descriptions use notes.
properties.title: Physical Description

properties.description: A description of such things as the range or habitat.
properties.title: Context

properties.description: The type of context being described.
properties.title: Context Type
